items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.

River levels have risen on the River Cole and Dorcan Brook as a result of persistent heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is expected later this afternoon (2 October 2021), especially in the Lower Stratton area. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further persistent rainfall is forecast over the next 3 hours. The rate of river level rise has reduced, but further heavy rain is expected, which may result in levels rising further this afternoon before stabilising and dropping overnight.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff have been in the area clearing weed and trash screens. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 3 October 2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River levels are high and forecast to rise further on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwentwater. Flooding is likely to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwentwater, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite and Derwentwater foreshore. Heavy showery rain is forecast throughout Saturday which will cause the rivers and Derwentwater to rise further, with a Flood Warning also in place for Keswick Campsite. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 03/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

This flood alert has been issued in response to overtopping waves and wind blown spray on Saturday afternoon, including a period of time after high tide. The particular area of concern is Bridlington Lifeboat Station between 2pm and 6pm today. Please take care around exposed promenades and roads where spray may create hazardous conditions. This message will be updated by 8pm on Saturday 2nd October.

items.description: Ravensbourne area in the London Boroughs of Lewisham, Bromley, Greenwich and Croydon
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Bromley, Croydon, Greater London, Greenwich, Lewisham

items.message:
River levels have risen as a result of heavy rainfall. Flooding of roads and low lying land is expected imminently today, 2 October 2021, around Kelsey Park. We expect flooding to affect land and roads. Property flooding is not currently expected.   

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 5 days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing trash screens and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required.

The level of Derwentwater is forecast to continue to rise overnight, peaking in the early hours of Sunday morning.
Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwentwater and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
The rainfall is expected to ease by late evening on Saturday 02/10/2021.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.
This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 03/10/2021, or as the situation changes.
